text: Hey team, it totally slipped my mind that I have a standing biweekly meeting with Andrea Bunt at 230 starting tomorrow for my industrial project class, and then I've got Physio right after. I'm gonna have to miss another meeting, please let me know if there's something I can do, I don't like missing two meetings in a row.

I also won't be able to make it. I've completely lost my voice and my head is pounding. All that's left is detailed user stories. If you guys need anything, I'll check slack periodically but I'm gonna try and sleep this cold off. Sorry guys
<@U0HUH2B1R> I'm gonna try just using a normal virtualbox VM to see if that works better today
Okay, so looks like npm and vagrant don't get along well. So it's probably best to just run a normal Ubuntu VM. Does everyone know how or should I try and find a guide somewhere?
It's pretty straightforward, I think everyone should be fine.
Yeah, I figured everyone would have a pretty good idea. If anyone needs help, just holler. I got an ubuntu VM working on Win10 this morning and the sample project on the github repo worked well
Should we all use nodeenv to make a virtual environments for node? Might save some headaches with node dependencies.
Isn’t it only useful when you have other node projects going on?
Yeah, if we're running VMs I don't think it would really serve any benefit
If you're running on your local linux machine, then I'd say go for it, but otherwise it just might be an extra step
Atleast I’m assuming nodeenv works similarly to virtualenv for python
Yeah, I think that's what it's based off of
That's true, if our VM is specific for our project then it's unnecessary
Not sure if anyone was using a preexisting single Ubuntu VM though
I would have used nodeenv if I knew it existed :stuck_out_tongue:
I might use it, only because I don't want to set up another fresh VM to save time setting up my basic environment again
word
So we actually have to figure out what CI tools we want. haha
I've never used any, but Travis CI is the one I see the most
we’re saying Travis CI for now
Sounds good
Pushed what we did this meeting.
Awesome. I'll make sure everything looks good and submit to d2l sometime tomorrow
suhweet
Go team :100:

ok dont do it yet though. im about to commit some edits

ok i just committed

I'm waiting for a bus right now, I'll make the changes in about 30 min
can i delete the detailed stories for the 3 big stories that we aren't going to be doing in iteration 1. I thought you guys said you were going to delete them but then nobody did?
Yeah

Ok last 2 things: 
1) has anyone read the vision statement yet? Its in the admin docs folder. 
2) Can we remove the "As a user," from the start of every Big user story? That's not how users speak, it doesn't add anything useful (they're called big USER stories) and i could've sworn braico said not to include that in your stories???
I have, I thought the vision statement was pretty good. And yes, I agree to that.

I'm a jerk, I'm sorry
such a jerk

cool. I pushed the latest copy. haha

I just read the vision statement, I think it's good, but I think this line should be the opener. It's too grandiose to be in the middle... "Since the dawn of time, finding a study partner that is as motivated and intelligent as oneself has been a pain point of the post-secondary education experience."
The big user stories and detailed user stories look good to me as well.
We need to get David Attenborough to read that and upload an audio clip of our vision statement
We missed our chance. He did an AMA last week.
Maybe we can splice together some clips to form that sentence
he’s probably used all those words on film
I'll get on it ASAP
Perfect
Is all we need now the project plan?
There’s a project plan?
Oh cost and stuff.
We did cost and priority today.
I think the release plan we kinda skipped.
Wanna quickly discuss it tomorrow?
I can't tell if it's something different, but yeah we should talk about it tomorrow
Yup

Are you all going to class tomorrow?
I'll be there
